sen.j: 西大路駅（にしおおじえき）は、京都府京都市南区 (京都市)唐橋西平垣町にある、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）東海道本線（JR京都線）の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Nishioji Station, located in Karahashi-nishi-hiragaki-cho, Minami Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railway station of the Tokaido Main Line (JR Kyoto Line) that is operated by West Japan Railway Company (JR West).

Nishioji Station, located in Karahashi-nishi-hiragaki-cho, Minami Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railway station of the Tokaido Main Line (JR Kyoto Line) that is operated by West Japan Railway Company (JR West).

Nishioji Station, located in Karahashi-nishi-hiragaki-cho, Minami Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railway station of the Tokaido Main Line (JR Kyoto Line) that is operated by West Japan Railway Company (JR West).

sen.j: ICOCA・Jスルー利用可能駅。
sen.e: ICOCA and J-through are available at this station.
ICOCA and J-through are available at this station.
ICOCA and J-through cards can be used at this station.
sen.cmt: 表現を一部変更しました。

sen.j: ICOCAの相互利用対象であるPiTaPa（スルッとKANSAI協議会）も利用可能。
sen.e: PiTaPa (SURUTTO KANSAI ASSOCIATION), which is mutually usable between ICOCA, is also available.
PiTaPa (SURUTTO KANSAI ASSOCIATION), which is mutually usable between ICOCA, is also available.
PiTaPa (SURUTTO KANSAI ASSOCIATION) card, which is mutually usable between ICOCA, can also be used.
sen.cmt: 表現を一部変更しました。

sen.j: プラットホーム2面4線の盛土上にある地上駅。
sen.e: This station is a ground station located on the mound and has 2 platforms for 4 tracks.
This station is a ground station located on a mound, and it has two platforms to serve four tracks.
This station is a ground station located on a mound, and it has two platforms to serve four tracks.

sen.j: 乗降には内側線の2線のみ使用（但し内側線も時間帯によっては快速の通過がある）。
sen.e: Only 2 inner tracks are used for passengers' getting on and off (depending on the time zone, however, Rapid trains pass through the inner tracks)
Only two inner tracks are used for passengers' getting on and off (however, depending on the time zone rapid trains pass through on the inner tracks).
Only two inner tracks are used for passengers' getting on and off (however, depending on the time zone rapid trains pass through on the inner tracks).

sen.j: 駅舎および1番線の頭上を東海道新幹線が通過する。
sen.e: The track of Tokaido Shinkansen is located above the station building and track 1.
The track for the Tokaido Shinkansen is located above the station building and Platform 1.
The track for the Tokaido Shinkansen is located above the station building and Platform 1.

sen.j: JRの特定都区市内制度における「京都市内」の駅であり、東海道線としては最も西となる。
sen.e: According to JR's fare calculation system called "Inside of Specified Cities System", this station is categorized as the station of "inside of Kyoto City" and it is the westernmost station of the Tokaido Main Line in this category.

According to JR's fare calculation system, called "Inside of Specified Cities System," this station is categorized as being "inside Kyoto City" and is the westernmost station of the Tokaido Main Line in this category.

According to JR's railway fare system of specific metropolitan and urban areas, this station is categorized as being 'inside Kyoto City' and is the westernmost station of the Tokaido Main Line in this category.
sen.cmt: 特定都区市内制度の表現を統一しました。

tit.cmt: 表現を他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約15,496人である（京都府統計書より）。
sen.e: Average number of passengers a day in 2006 was 15,496 (based on the statistics compiled by Kyoto Prefectural Government).
According to statistics compiled by the Kyoto Prefectural Government, the average number of passengers a day in 2006 was 15,496.
According to statistics compiled by the Kyoto Prefectural Government, the average number of passengers a day in fiscal year 2006 was 15,496.

sen.j: 西大路駅前
sen.e: Nishioji-Eki (station)-Mae
Nishioji-Eki (station)-Mae
Nishioji-Eki (station)-Mae

sen.j: バス停は駅前ではなく、駅から徒歩2分の西大路通沿いにある。
sen.e: Bus stop is not situated in front of the station but along the Nishioji-dori Street, 2 minutes walk from the station.
The bus stop isn't situated in front of the station but instead along Nishioji-dori Street, a two-minute walk from the station.
The bus stop isn't situated in front of the station but instead along Nishioji-dori Street, a two-minute walk from the station.

sen.j: これは駅直下の立体交差が掘割構造になっており、その位置にバス停を設置する事が不可能なことによる。
sen.e: The background of the above is that the canal structure of the grade separate crossing situated just below the station makes it impossible to set a bus stop there.
The background of the above is that the canal structure of the grade separate crossing situated just below the station made it impossible to place a bus stop there.
The background of the above is that the canal structure of the grade separate crossing situated just below the station made it impossible to place a bus stop there.

sen.j: ちなみに、昭和58年（1983年）までは西大路九条を名乗っていたが、現在の位置に西大路九条を新設し、従来の西大路九条を西大路駅前と改称した。
sen.e: Incidentally, the name of this bus stop used to be Nishioji Kujo until 1983 but after Nishioji Kujo bus stop was set at the place where it is now situated, the name of this bus stop was changed from Nishioji Kujo to Nishioji-Eki (station)-Mae.

Incidentally, the name of this bus stop was Nishioji Kujo until 1983, but after the Nishioji Kujo bus stop was placed in its current location, the name of this bus stop was changed from Nishioji Kujo to Nishioji-Eki (station)-Mae.

Incidentally, the name of this bus stop was Nishioji Kujo until 1983, but after the Nishioji Kujo bus stop was placed in its current location, the name of this bus stop was changed from Nishioji Kujo to Nishioji-Eki (station)-Mae.

sen.j: 1938年（昭和13年）9月16日 - 日本国有鉄道の駅として開業。
sen.e: September 16, 1938 - The station commenced operation as the station of Japan National railways (JNR).
September 16, 1938 - The station commenced operation as a facility of Japan National Railways (JNR).
September 16, 1938: The station commenced operation as a facility of Japan National Railways (JNR).

sen.j: 旅客取扱のみ。
sen.e: Passengers service only.
Passenger service only
Passenger service only

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 - 国鉄分割民営化により、JR西日本の駅となる。
sen.e: April 1, 1987 - The station became the station of JR West thanks to the division and privatization of JNR.
April 1, 1987 - The station became a facility of JR West thanks to the division and privatization of JNR.
April 1, 1987: The station became a facility of JR West due to the division and privatization of JNR.

sen.j: この先向日町駅まで京都市南区→西京区→再び南区→向日市となっている。
sen.e: From this station to Mukomachi Station, the line runs in Minami Ward of Kyoto City, Nishikyo Ward, Minami Ward again and Muko City.
From this station to Mukomachi Station, the line runs through Minami Ward of Kyoto City, Nishikyo Ward, Minami Ward again, and Muko City.
From this station to Mukomachi Station, the line runs through Minami Ward of Kyoto City, Nishikyo Ward, Minami Ward again, and Muko City.

sen.j: 「再び南区」の地点にはJR桂駅（仮称）が設置予定であるが、結局西京区は素通りとなった（なお、西京区内のJR西日本の駅は山陰本線（嵯峨野線）の保津峡駅がある（亀岡市との市境付近））。
sen.e: Katsuragawa Station was established at the place where the line "runs in Minami Ward again" but eventually no station was established in Nishikyo Ward (JR West' station located in Nishikyo Ward is Hozukyo Station of the San'in Main Line (Sagano Line) (located nearly at the border between Kameoka City)

Katsuragawa Station was established at the place where the line "runs through Minami Ward again," but eventually no station was established in Nishikyo Ward (JR West' station located in Nishikyo Ward is Hozukyo Station of the San'in Main Line (Sagano Line) (located nearly at the border with Kameoka City).

Katsuragawa Station was established at the place where the line 'runs through Minami Ward again,' but eventually no station was established in Nishikyo Ward (JR West' station located in Nishikyo Ward is Hozukyo Station of the Sanin Main Line (Sagano Line) (located nearly at the border with Kameoka City)).
sen.cmt: " → ' としました。Sanin としました。

sen.j: 朝ラッシュ時の混雑はひどく列車から降りた客で乗車客がホームにあがれず列車が発車してしまうケースが多発した。
sen.e: The congestion at this station in the morning rush hour is so heavy that passengers often miss the train which they want to get on because they cannot go up to the platform due to too many passengers who have got down from the train in question.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The congestion at this station in the morning rush hour is so heavy that passengers often miss their trains because they can't go up to the platform due to the large numbers of passengers who have left the train in question.

The congestion at this station in the morning rush hour is so heavy that passengers often miss their trains because they can't go up to the platform due to the large numbers of passengers who have left the train in question.

sen.j: そのため階段に上り下りをわける線が引かれたが全くと言っていいほど守られておらず状況は改善されていない。
sen.e: In order to improve such situation, the line which divides passengers going up and those going down was drawn on the stairs but it is not observed at all and the situation has not been improved.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In order to improve the situation, the line that divides passengers going up and those going down was drawn on the stairs; however, it isn't observed at all, so there has been no improvement in the situation.

In order to improve the situation, the line that divides passengers going up and those going down was drawn on the stairs; however, it isn't observed at all, so there has been no improvement in the situation.

sen.j: 未だにエレベーターやエスカレーターは設置されていないが、狭いホームと階段では設置するには大規模改修をしなければならず、また駅舎が東海道新幹線の橋脚と一体化しているためバリアフリーの面でも課題を残している。
sen.e: Though elevators and/or escalators are not yet installed, large scale renovation is required for installing such facilities because of narrow platforms and stairs and barrier-free facilities are also not enough because the station building is unified with the bridge piers of the Tokaido Shinkansen.

Though elevators and/or escalators aren't yet installed, large-scale renovation is required for the installation of such facilities due to narrow platforms and stairs; moreover, barrier-free facilities aren't sufficient because the station building is unified with the bridge piers of the Tokaido Shinkansen.

Though elevators and/or escalators aren't yet installed, large-scale renovation is required for the installation of such facilities due to narrow platforms and stairs; moreover, barrier-free facilities aren't sufficient because the station building is unified with the bridge piers of the Tokaido Shinkansen.
